spell.name: Avalanche (HB)
spell.components: S, M (A small barrel of alcohol worth at least 10 gold)
spell.text:
A wave of snow and ice shoots forth in a 30 ft. cone. All creatures within the cone must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, creatures take 3d6 cold damage plus 3d6 bludgeoning damage and are pushed 20 ft. away and knocked prone. On a successful save, creatures take half the damage and are otherwise unaffected.
At higher levels: When you cast this spell at 4th level or higher, the length of the cone increases by 5 ft. and the cold damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 35 (Third Party)

spell.name: Bounty of Apples (HB)
spell.components: V, M (A falcon feather and a nut)
spell.text:
Up to 10 magical apples appear in your hands. As an action, a creature can eat one of the apples, regaining 1d8 hit points. Additionally, the creature is resistant to piercing, slashing, and bludgeoning damage for one minute, and they do not age for that minute. Each apple provides enough nourishment for one day. The apples lose their magic if they have not been consumed within 24 hours of casting this spell.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 35 (Third Party)

spell.name: Edda of Heroics (HB)
spell.components: V, M (A master crafted instrument worth at least 1,000gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
You begin reciting an epic poem that takes 1 hour to perform. The benefits of the edda don't set in until this hour is over. Up to twelve other creatures can gain the benefit of the edda. A creature that listens to the entirety of the edda gains several benefits. The creature gains 30 temporary hit points, becomes immune to the frightened and charmed condition, makes Constitution saving throws with advantage, and gains one inspiration. Those benefits last for 24 hours.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 35 (Third Party)

spell.name: Mistletoe Dart (HB)
spell.text:
A single dart of mistletoe shoots out like an arrow toward a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 6d4 piercing damage. This damage ignores resistances and immunities. If the target has resistance to piercing damage, increase the damage dice to d6s. If it has immunity to piercing damage, increase the damage dice to d8s. If the target is a celestial, fiend, fey, monstrosity, or undead, any successful attacks with this spell are considered critical hits.
At higher levels: When you cast this spell as a 4th level or higher, increase the damage dealt by 2d4 for each spell slot above 3rd.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 36 (Third Party)
